definition: to live somewhere as a visitor/to stay with sb as a guest/to sojourn
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.chinese: 今晚有人要去他們那裏作客。

sentences.english: I often visited The Gables when I was a boy.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候常去“山牆莊園”作客。

sentences.english: Then Israel came to Egypt, Jacob settled in the land of Ham.
sentences.chinese: 從此以色列進入了埃及，雅各伯也就在含邦作客。

sentences.english: But one tradition is to bring a nice bottle of wine.
sentences.chinese: 但是美國人去朋友家作客，有帶葡萄酒的傳統。

sentences.english: Ni Ping sojourns to Meng Cheng, on dish one ox flogs, taste is especially good, ask why content?
sentences.chinese: 倪萍到蒙城作客，菜上一牛鞭，味道特好，問曰何物？

sentences.english: She knew well that a woman's vis. t is. apt to spin itself out for an indeterminate time.
sentences.chinese: 她很清楚，一個女人作客很容易無限期地延續下去。

sentences.english: I believe away games will decide the destiny of the Championship this season.
sentences.chinese: 我相信今季英超冠軍的命運將會取決於作客比賽之上。

sentences.english: The westerner thought that leaves behind the address to the human, must ask opposite party to sojourn proficiently .
sentences.chinese: 西方人認爲給人留下住址，就得請對方到家作客。

sentences.english: As roamers, we are of the same line.
sentences.chinese: 我們一樣是作客在天涯。

sentences.english: The best fish smell when they are three days old.
sentences.chinese: 最好的魚三天也要變臭;作客不可久留。

sentences.english: We befriended her when she first arrived in Beijing as a guest.
sentences.chinese: 她初到北京作客時，我們如同朋友一般地照顧她。

sentences.english: On New Years Day, I invited him to the White House the next day.
sentences.chinese: 新年那天，我邀請他第二天來白宮作客。

sentences.english: But Looney did not think that sojourns ancient to abdicate the park field to be able to be very relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 但是魯尼不認爲作客古迪遜公園球場會很輕鬆。

sentences.english: We had a pleasant visit, discussing the election and world affairs.
sentences.chinese: 大家在作客期間都非常愉快，談論了大選和世界事務。

sentences.english: Would you honor us with a visit?
She also often go to Copenhagen Jia Zuoke Bohr.
sentences.chinese: 她還經常到哥本哈根去玻爾家作客。

definition: to be a guest or visitor
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to move troops to/(fig.) to move to/to shift to
